commitment.translation[0].definitions[0]: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way
Are you ready to make a long-term commitment?
Our company has a commitment to quality and customer service.
commitment.translation[0].definitions[1]: the hard work and loyalty that someone gives to an organization, activity etc
I was impressed by the energy and commitment shown by the players.
Her commitment to work is beyond question.
commitment.translation[0].definitions[2]: something that you have promised you will do or that you have to do
Will the job fit in with your family commitments?
commitment.translation[0].definitions[3]: an amount of money that you have to pay regularly
I had a lot of financial commitments.
commitment.translation[0].definitions[4]: the use of money, time, people etc for a particular purpose
commitments of food and medical aid of over $4 billion
commitment.translation[0].note_box[0].se: Getting married involves making a serious commitment.
The government gave a commitment to withdraw all its forces.
Nursing as a profession demands genuine commitment.
Will they honour their commitment to a ceasefire?
Throughout her life she demonstrated her deep commitment to the needs of the poor.
I never get promoted because they think I lack commitment.
They reaffirmed their commitment to abandon nuclear power.
The job demands real commitment to teaching.
As a company, we expect a personal commitment from our staff to do their best.
She's known for her strong commitment to women's rights.
Having a child together involves a long-term commitment.
Such therapies demand full commitment from the patient.
There was no local political commitment to the proposal.
Many people have ceased to have any active religious commitment.
His lack of commitment to the project was easy to see.
This post demands a high level of commitment.
commitment.translation[1].definitions[0]: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way
He’s made a commitment to improve the quality of life for people in Gloucestershire.
a commitment to equal pay and opportunities
commitment.translation[1].definitions[1]: the hard work and loyalty that someone gives to an organization or activity
Sue will be greatly missed for her enthusiasm and commitment.
The Group’s success is a direct result of commitment by staff to high standards of service.
commitment.translation[1].definitions[2]: something that you have to do that prevents you from doing something else
Mr Reid has a previous commitment and is unable to attend the meeting.
part time work for people with family commitments
commitment.translation[1].definitions[3]: an amount of money that you have to pay regularly and that prevents you from spending your money on other things
A mortgage may be the largest financial commitment you will make in your life.
commitment.translation[1].definitions[4]: the use of money, time, people etc for a particular purpose
The plan involves commitment of large amounts of money and staff time.
